Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
public class Player extends Object
Player is the protagonist of the game that the user controls. The objective of the Player is to catch naM-caP, unless naM-caP is in its superpower phase, and earn as many points as possible
Author:
Brianna, Desiree, Jenna

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player​(processing.core.PImage img, processing.core.PImage eyes, int x, int y, Map m)
      Constructs a Player and initiates Player type to "" and the score to 0. X and Y should be the center of grid.
      Parameters:
      img - The Player's image.
      eyes - An image of the Player's eyes.
      x - X-value of the Player.
      y - Y-value of the Player.
      m - The Map the Player is on.

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw​(processing.core.PApplet g)
      Draws the player.
      Parameters:
      g - The PApplet used to draw.

    • move

      public void move()
      Moves the Player one space forward in the direction it is facing

    • canMove

      public boolean canMove​(int dir)
      Returns if the player can move one space forward in the direction.
      Parameters:
      dir - The new direction of the Player.
      Returns:
      true if the player can move one space forward in the direction, false if not.

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection​(int dir)
      Sets the direction of the player.
      Parameters:
      dir - The angle of the player's direction (0 is the +x axis).

    • getDirection

      public int getDirection()
      Returns:
      The Player's direction.

    • loseLife

      public void loseLife()
      Removes a life from the Player.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the Player to the starting position and direction.

    • getLives

      public int getLives()
      Returns:
      The number of lives the Player has.

    • resetLives

      public void resetLives()
      Resets the number of lives back to 3.

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Returns:
      X-value of the Player's location.

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Returns:
      Y-value of the Player's location.

    • setX

      public void setX​(int xval)
      Sets the X-value of the Player's location.
      Parameters:
      xval - The new X-value.

    • setY

      public void setY​(int yval)
      Sets the Y-value of the Player's location.
      Parameters:
      yval - The new Y-value.

    • atSameLocation

      public boolean atSameLocation​(NamCap n)
      Determines if the Player and naM-caP are at the same spot.
      Parameters:
      n - naM-caP.
      Returns:
      true if at same location, false if not.

    • atSameLocationFruit

      public boolean atSameLocationFruit​(Fruit f)
      Parameters:
      f - The Fruit.
      Returns:
      If the Player is at the same location as the given Fruit.

    • eatFruit

      public void eatFruit​(Fruit f)
      Eats the Fruit and gains a special ability depending on the Fruit.
      Parameters:
      f - The Fruit eaten.

    • increaseScore

      public void increaseScore​(int points)
      Increases the Player's score by a certain amount.
      Parameters:
      points - The amount of points to add to the score.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Returns:
      The score of the Player.

    • getHighScore

      public int getHighScore()
      Returns:
      The Player's high score.

    • setHighScore

      public void setHighScore​(int hs)
      Sets the high score of the Player.
      Parameters:
      hs - The new high score.

    • setScore

      public void setScore​(int score)
      Sets the score of the Player.
      Parameters:
      score - The new score.

    • setTint

      public void setTint​(String tint)
      Sets the tint coloring of the Player for choiceGhost.
      Parameters:
      tint - A string of the HEX code for the ghost's color.
